unnormalised: Regarding the recent judgment in Criminal Appeal No. 456/2023, filed on 10/07/2023, it is crucial to note that Section 304B of the IPC (Indian Penal Code) regarding dowry death necessitates a thorough investigation into unnatural death occurring within 7 years of marriage. Adv. Sharma highlighted discrepancies in the evidence presented by the defense, citing precedent from similar cases previously heard in the Delhi High Court. The court’s decision to overturn the lower court's acquittal underscores the gravity of offenses under CrPC Section 125 and the prosecution's responsibility to establish guilt beyond a reasonable doubt.
normalised: Regarding the recent judgment in Criminal Appeal Number four hundred and fifty six slash two thousand and twenty three, filed on tenth July two thousand and twenty three, it is crucial to note that Section three hundred and four B of the I-P-C (Indian Penal Code) regarding dowry death necessitates a thorough investigation into unnatural death occurring within seven years of marriage. Advocate Sharma highlighted discrepancies in the evidence presented by the defense, citing precedent from similar cases previously heard in the Delhi High Court. The court’s decision to overturn the lower court's acquittal underscores the gravity of offenses under C-R-P-C Section one hundred and twenty five and the prosecution's responsibility to establish guilt beyond a reasonable doubt.
